intro: Youngia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Youngia mauritiana is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
